TranscannoSplitTagToOne.SplitToOne

Class TranscannoImporter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.corpus_tools.pepper.impl.PepperModuleImpl
      • org.corpus_tools.pepper.impl.PepperImporterImpl
        • TranscannoSplitTagToOne.SplitToOne.TranscannoImporter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler, org.corpus_tools.pepper.modules.PepperImporter, org.corpus_tools.pepper.modules.PepperModule

    public class TranscannoImporter
extends org.corpus_tools.pepper.impl.PepperImporterImpl
implements org.corpus_tools.pepper.modules.PepperImporter
    This is a dummy implementation of a PepperImporter, which can be used as a template to create your own module from. The current implementation creates a corpus-structure looking like this: 
           c1
    /      \
   c2      c3
  /  \    /  \
 d1  d2  d3  d4
    For each document d1, d2, d3 and d4 the same document-structure is created. The document-structure contains the following structure and annotations:
    1. primary data
    2. tokenization
    3. part-of-speech annotation for tokenization
    4. information structure annotation via spans
    5. anaphoric relation via pointing relation
    6. syntactic annotations
    This dummy implementation is supposed to give you an impression, of how Pepper works and how you can create your own implementation along that dummy. It further shows some basics of creating a simple Salt model.
    This code contains a lot of TODO's. Please have a look at them and adapt the code for your needs At least, a list of not used but helpful methods:
    • the salt model to fill can be accessed via PepperModuleImpl.getSaltProject()
    • customization properties can be accessed via PepperModuleImpl.getProperties()
    • a place where resources of this bundle are, can be accessed via PepperModuleImpl.getResources()
    If this is the first time, you are implementing a Pepper module, we strongly recommend, to take a look into the 'Developer's Guide for Pepper modules', you will find on http://corpus-tools.org/pepper.
    Author:
    NadezdaOkinina

    • Method Detail

      • importCorpusStructure

        public void importCorpusStructure(org.corpus_tools.salt.common.SCorpusGraph sCorpusGraph)
                           throws org.corpus_tools.pepper.modules.exceptions.PepperModuleException
        OVERRIDE THIS METHOD FOR CUSTOMIZATION
        This method is called by the pepper framework to import the corpus-structure for the passed SCorpusGraph object. In Pepper each import step gets an own SCorpusGraph to work on. This graph has to be filled with SCorpus and SDocument objects representing the corpus-structure of the corpus to be imported.
        In many cases, the corpus-structure can be retrieved from the file-structure of the source files. Therefore Pepper provides a default mechanism to map the file-structure to corpus-structure. This default mechanism can be configured. To adapt the default behavior to your needs, we recommend, to take a look into the 'Developer's Guide for Pepper modules', you will find on https ://u.hu-berlin.de/saltnpepper/.
        Just to show the creation of a corpus-structure for our sample purpose, we here create a simple corpus-structure manually. The simple contains a root-corpus c1 having two sub-corpora c2 and c3. Each sub-corpus contains two documents d1 and d2 for d3 and d4 and c1 for c3. 
               c1
    /      \
   c2      c3
  /  \    /  \
 d1  d2  d3  d4
        The URIs of the corpora and documents would be:
        • salt:/c1
        • salt:/c1/c2
        • salt:/c1/c2/d1
        • salt:/c1/c2/d2
        • salt:/c1/c3
        • salt:/c1/c3/d3
        • salt:/c1/c3/d4
        Specified by:
        importCorpusStructure in interface org.corpus_tools.pepper.modules.PepperImporter
        Overrides:
        importCorpusStructure in class org.corpus_tools.pepper.impl.PepperImporterImpl
        Parameters:
        corpusGraph - the CorpusGraph object, which has to be filled.
        Throws:
        org.corpus_tools.pepper.modules.exceptions.PepperModuleException

      • createPepperMapper

        public org.corpus_tools.pepper.modules.PepperMapper createPepperMapper(org.corpus_tools.salt.graph.Identifier Identifier)
        OVERRIDE THIS METHOD FOR CUSTOMIZATION
        This method creates a customized PepperMapper object and returns it. You can here do some additional initialisations. Thinks like setting the Identifier of the SDocument or SCorpus object and the URI resource is done by the framework (or more in detail in method PepperImporterImpl.start()).
        The parameter Identifier, if a PepperMapper object should be created in case of the object to map is either an SDocument object or an SCorpus object of the mapper should be initialized differently.
        Just to show how the creation of such a mapper works, we here create a sample mapper of type TranscannoImporter.TranscannoMapper, which only produces a fixed document-structure in method TranscannoImporter.TranscannoMapper.mapSDocument() and enhances the corpora for further meta-annotations in the method TranscannoImporter.TranscannoMapper.mapSCorpus().
        If your mapper needs to have set variables, this is the place to do it.
        Specified by:
        createPepperMapper in interface org.corpus_tools.pepper.modules.PepperModule
        Overrides:
        createPepperMapper in class org.corpus_tools.pepper.impl.PepperModuleImpl
        Parameters:
        Identifier - Identifier of the SCorpus or SDocument to be processed.
        Returns:
        PepperMapper object to do the mapping task for object connected to given Identifier

      • isImportable

        public java.lang.Double isImportable(org.eclipse.emf.common.util.URI corpusPath)
        OVERRIDE THIS METHOD FOR CUSTOMIZATION
        This method is called by the pepper framework and returns if a corpus located at the given URI is importable by this importer. If yes, 1 must be returned, if no 0 must be returned. If it is not quite sure, if the given corpus is importable by this importer any value between 0 and 1 can be returned. If this method is not overridden, null is returned.
        Specified by:
        isImportable in interface org.corpus_tools.pepper.modules.PepperImporter
        Overrides:
        isImportable in class org.corpus_tools.pepper.impl.PepperImporterImpl
        Returns:
        1 if corpus is importable, 0 if corpus is not importable, 0 < X < 1, if no definitive answer is possible, null if method is not overridden

      • isReadyToStart

        public boolean isReadyToStart()
                       throws org.corpus_tools.pepper.modules.exceptions.PepperModuleNotReadyException
        OVERRIDE THIS METHOD FOR CUSTOMIZATION
        This method is called by the pepper framework after initializing this object and directly before start processing. Initializing means setting properties PepperModuleProperties, setting temporary files, resources etc. returns false or throws an exception in case of PepperModule instance is not ready for any reason.
        So if there is anything to do, before your importer can start working, do it here.
        Specified by:
        isReadyToStart in interface org.corpus_tools.pepper.modules.PepperModule
        Overrides:
        isReadyToStart in class org.corpus_tools.pepper.impl.PepperModuleImpl
        Returns:
        false, PepperModule instance is not ready for any reason, true, else.
        Throws:
        org.corpus_tools.pepper.modules.exceptions.PepperModuleNotReadyException
